1.verse: Chapter 1 - Oracle concerning Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum of Elkosh.

2.verse: God’s Terrifying Appearance - A jealous and avenging God is the LORD, an avenger is the LORD, full of wrath; The LORD takes vengeance on his adversaries, and rages against his enemies;

3.verse: The LORD is slow to anger, yet great in power; the LORD will not leave the guilty unpunished. In stormwind and tempest he comes, and clouds are the dust at his feet;

4.verse: He roars at the sea and leaves it dry, and all the rivers he dries up. Laid low are Bashan and Carmel, and the bloom of Lebanon withers;

5.verse: The mountains quake before him, and the hills dissolve; The earth is laid waste before him, the world and all who dwell in it.

6.verse: Before his wrath, who can stand firm, and who can face his blazing anger? His fury is poured out like fire, and boulders break apart before him.

7.verse: The LORD is good to those who wait for him, a refuge on the day of distress, Taking care of those who look to him for protection,

8.verse: when the flood rages; He makes an end of his opponents, and pursues his enemies into darkness.

9.verse: Nineveh’s Judgment and Judah’s Restoration - What do you plot against the LORD, the one about to bring total destruction? No opponent rises a second time!

10.verse: Like a thorny thicket, they are tangled, and like drunkards, they are drunk; like dry stubble, they are utterly consumed.

11.verse: From you has come one plotting evil against the LORD, one giving sinister counsel.

12.verse: Thus says the LORD: though fully intact and so numerous, they shall be mown down and disappear. Though I have humbled you, I will humble you no more.

13.verse: Now I will break his yoke off of you, and tear off your bonds.

14.verse: The LORD has commanded regarding you: no descendant will again bear your name; From the house of your gods I will abolish the carved and the molten image; I will make your grave a dung heap.

15.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

1.verse: Chapter 2 - At this moment on the mountains the footsteps of one bearing good news, of one announcing peace! Celebrate your feasts, Judah, fulfill your vows! For never again will destroyers invade you; they are completely cut off.

2.verse: The Attack on Nineveh - One who scatters has come up against you; guard the rampart, Watch the road, brace yourselves, marshal all your strength!

3.verse: The LORD will restore the vine of Jacob, the honor of Israel, Because ravagers have ravaged them and ruined their branches.

4.verse: The shields of his warriors are crimsoned, the soldiers clad in scarlet; Like fire are the trappings of the chariots on the day he prepares for war; the cavalry is agitated!

5.verse: The chariots dash madly through the streets and wheel in the squares, Looking like torches, bolting like lightning.

6.verse: His picked troops are called, ranks break at their charge; To the wall they rush, their screen is set up.

7.verse: The river gates are opened, the palace is washed away.

8.verse: The mistress is led forth captive, and her maidservants led away, Moaning like doves, beating their breasts.

9.verse: Nineveh is like a pool whose waters escape; “Stop! Stop!” but none turns back.

10.verse: “Plunder the silver, plunder the gold!” There is no end to the treasure, to wealth in every precious thing!

11.verse: Emptiness, desolation, waste; melting hearts and trembling knees, Churning in every stomach, every face turning pale!

12.verse: Where is the lionesses’ den, the young lions’ cave, Where the lion went in and out, and the cub, with no one to disturb them?

13.verse: The lion tore apart enough for his cubs, and strangled for his lionesses; He filled his lairs with prey, and his dens with torn flesh.

1.verse: Chapter 3 - Ah! The bloody city, all lies, Full of plunder, whose looting never stops!

2.verse: The crack of the whip, the rumbling of wheels; Horses galloping, chariots bounding,

3.verse: Cavalry charging, the flash of the sword, the gleam of the spear; A multitude of slain, a mass of corpses, Endless bodies to stumble upon!

4.verse: For the many debaucheries of the prostitute, a charming mistress of witchcraft, Who enslaved nations with her prostitution, and peoples by her witchcraft:

5.verse: I now come against you— oracle of the LORD of hosts— and I will lift your skirt above your face; I will show your nakedness to the nations, to the kingdoms your shame!

6.verse: I will cast filth upon you, disgrace you and make you a spectacle;

7.verse: Until everyone who sees you runs from you saying, “Nineveh is destroyed; who can pity her? Where can I find any to console you?”

8.verse: Nineveh’s Inescapable Fate - Are you better than No-amon that was set among the Nile’s canals, Surrounded by waters, with the river for her rampart and water for her wall?

9.verse: Ethiopia was her strength, and Egypt without end; Put and the Libyans were her allies.

10.verse: Yet even she became an exile, and went into captivity; Even her little ones were dashed to pieces at the corner of every street; For her nobles they cast lots, and all her great ones were put into chains.

11.verse: You, too, will drink of this; you will be overcome; You, too, will seek a refuge from the foe.

12.verse: But all your fortresses are fig trees, bearing early figs; When shaken, they fall into the devourer’s mouth.

13.verse: Indeed your troops are women in your midst; To your foes are open wide the gates of your land, fire has consumed their bars.

14.verse: Draw water for the siege, strengthen your fortresses; Go down into the mud and tread the clay, take hold of the brick mold!

15.verse: There the fire will consume you, the sword will cut you down; it will consume you like the grasshoppers. Multiply like the grasshoppers, multiply like the locusts!

16.verse: You have made your traders more numerous than the stars of the heavens; like grasshoppers that shed their skins and fly away.

17.verse: Your sentries are like locusts, and your scribes like locust swarms Gathered on the rubble fences on a cold day! Yet when the sun rises, they vanish, and no one knows where they have gone.

18.verse: Your shepherds slumber, O king of Assyria, your nobles have gone to rest; Your people are scattered upon the mountains, with none to gather them.

19.verse: There is no healing for your hurt, your wound is fatal. All who hear this news of you clap their hands over you; For who has not suffered under your endless malice?
